title: 107_hr2784
content: The "Family and Medical Leave Enhancement Act of 2001" amends the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 to change the eligibility criteria for employees from "less than 50" to "fewer than 25". Additionally, it provides for additional leave for parental involvement. The Family and Medical Leave Enhancement Act of 2001 expands parental involvement leave under the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993. Eligible employees can take up to 4 hours of leave in a 30-day period and 24 hours in a 12-month period to participate in school or community activities related to their child or grandchild's program. The term 'school' refers to elementary or secondary schools, Head Start programs, and licensed child care facilities. 'Community organization' is defined as a private nonprofit organization that represents a community and provides activities. Section 102 of the Act is amended to allow intermittent or reduced leave schedules under subsection (a)(3)(A) and substitution of paid leave for any part of the 24-hour period of such leave. Section 102 of the Act allows intermittent or reduced leave schedules under subsection (a)(3)(A) and substitution of paid leave for any part of the 24-hour period of such leave. An employee requesting leave under subsection (a)(3)(A) must provide the employer with at least 7 days' notice before the leave begins. Employers may require certification for parental involvement leave under section 102(a)(3)(A) as prescribed by the Secretary. Parental involvement leave for civil servants is addressed in Section 4 of the Act. Parental involvement leave for civil servants is addressed in Section 4 of the Act. An employee is entitled to 4 hours of leave every 30 days and 24 hours per year to participate in school or community activities related to their child's program. The Act allows for parental involvement leave for civil servants, providing 4 hours of leave every 30 days and 24 hours per year for participation in school or community activities related to their child's program. The amendments include defining terms like "community organization" and allowing intermittent or reduced leave schedules. Paid leave can be substituted with accrued annual leave for specific purposes. The Act allows parental involvement leave for civil servants, providing 24 hours per year for participation in school or community activities related to their child's program. Employees must give 7 days' notice before taking this leave and may need certification from the employing agency. SEC. 5. CLARIFICATION OF LEAVE ENTITLEMENT. Amends the Family and Medical Leave Act to include provisions for routine family medical needs and care for elderly relatives. SEC. 6. DEFINITION OF GRANDCHILD. SEC. 6. DEFINITION OF GRANDCHILD. Amends the Family and Medical Leave Act to define 'grandchild' as a son or daughter of an employee's child.
